links.pullQuote:
1/ Gemini passes ChatGPT in terms of DAUs, MAUs, and tokens consumed in the first half of 2026, making Google the king of AI.
2/ The Democrats take control of the House in the Nov 2026 elections, bringing to an end Trump's complete control of the US government.
3/ Smartglasses finally reach product market fit in 2026, but it won't be Meta that delivers the winning approach.

links.source: Democracy Will Not Survive the Age of Consumption
links.pullQuote: In this schema, the productive middle occupies an increasingly untenable position. They are too numerous to ignore but too dispersed to organise effectively. They lack the cultural capital to dominate elite discourse and the electoral weight to dominate mass politics. Their interests are in lower taxes, less regulation, stable money, and predictable institutions; precisely those that the top-bottom coalition has no incentive to provide. What, then, are their options?
